title: RM Schindler Buildings
name: RM Schindler Buildings
description:
A Map by Scootdown

(33 of 35 structures) Here are plotted buildings of R.M. Schindler (Rudolf Michael Schindler, lived: 1887 to 1953). Schindler was an Austrian-American architect who worked in Los Angeles during the mid-20th century. A student of Frank LLoyd Wright and once partner with Neutra, he is often associated with the fringes of the modern movement in architecture, yet worked and trained with some of its foremost practitioners.

properties.name: Elliot House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown  4237 Newdale Dr, Los Angeles, CA 900271930. On a small, inclined property in Los Feliz, this house is another classic example of Schindler\'s style. The house was intentionally built to promote the growth of ivy on the property, to offer provicy from the nearby neighbors. The house is an interesting study in geometry, with its dominating horizontal-verticle weaving lines. \'Gesamtkunstwerk\' or \'complete-art work\' emerges here, the old European ideal of building and placing custom furniture to complete the space. Also, notice the matching car port. [L.A. Historic Cultural Monument 690, Declared 02/06/2001]

properties.name: Gold Residence
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 3758 Reklaw Dr Studio City, CA 916041940-1941

properties.name: Grokowsky House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 816 Bonita Dr, South Pasadena, CA 910301928. More stucco, redwood and another steep hill site, the signature of Schindler\'s style. The roof appears to be flat, steps up in stages, to match the incline of the hill, thus, allowing light to enter. The main entrance is actually on the top of the hill and the roof of the garage is actually used as a sundeck.

properties.name: Howe House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 2422 Silver Ridge Ave, Los Angeles, CA 900391925. This house is on a steep hill in Silverlake. This space had a residential and office space for the owner, Dr. Howe. it has many terraces and is often described as being "wrightian" in its design due to its angles, entrance, and garden court.

properties.name: Mackay Apartment Building

properties.name: Manola Court Apartments
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown1811 Edgecliff Dr, Silver Lake, CA 900261926-1928. This apartment building was built for Herman Sachs as business venture. The building marks Schindler\'s departure from using cement construction in favor for wood and stucco. A little path runs through the building, which is built on steep, sloting site. Thus, giving the appearance of a Mediteranean hill town.

properties.name: McAlmon Residence
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 2721 Waverly Dr, Los Feliz, CA 900391935-1936

properties.name: Mr. George R. & Mrs. Rose L. Harris Residence
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown  7940 Willow Glen Road, Los Angeles, CA1942.

properties.name: Oliver House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 2236 Micheltorena Street, Los Angeles, Ca1933-1934. With distant views of both the ocean and the mountians, the U-shaped plan is placed diagonally across a long rectangular site. Features a strong sculpted roof, a signature of Schindler\'s style. The modern interior features built-in furniture.

properties.name: P. Lovell Beach House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown  1242 West Oceanfront, Newport Beach, CA 92661-10271922-1926. Considered Schindler\'s 2nd most important work, this structure is viewed as being one of the most influential works of modernism in the US.

properties.name: Packard House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 931 north Gainsborough Drive, Pasadena, CA, 911071924. Similar to the Schindler/ Chase house on Kings Road. Schindler blurs the line between indoor/ outdoor relationships. He was constricted by local regulations at the time and was forced to use pitched roofs. Otherwise, the structure is very similar to other buildings, with it\'s use of bare concrete and wood.

properties.name: Presburger Residence
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 4255 Agnes Ave., Studio City1945-1947

properties.name: Pueblo Ribera Court
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown230 Gravilla Street, La Jolla, California1923-1925. Actual addresses: 230-248 Gravilla Street. These were vacation houses for W.L. Lloyd, 12 units arranged for excellent views of the Pacific Ocean, with a large garden courts. The structures have been altered since and have been partially damaged from a fire. http://www.hottr6.com/pueblo/

properties.name: Roxy Roth Residence
properties.description: Posted by Susanorlean3624 Buena Park Drive

properties.name: Schindler / Chace House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 835 North Kings Road, Hollywood, California1921-1922. Schindler\'s most important work. it was a collaborative piece between him, his wife, Pauline, and Clyde and Marian Chace. This house became the model for the famous Case Study House Program after WWII. It is now the office for MAK Center for Art and Architecture in Los Angeles, who promote and preserve the work of Austrian architects that contributed to the city.

properties.name: Wolfe House (destroyed)
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown1928-1929. Old Stage Road, Avalon, Catalina Ssland, CA. Schindler\'s most remarkable hillside home, this house was easily seen from the harbor. Built for Ethel and Charles Wolfe, to promote their costume business in Los Angles, it was more of a summer home. All of the projecting roofs are used as decks, once again showing Schindler\'s desire to utalize the exterior spaces of a home. Since Destroyed (Summer 2001).
